trans-unit.target: [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) lets your Universal Windows app access sensors and peripheral devices in the background, even when your foreground app is suspended.

trans-unit.source: Device background task overview
trans-unit.target: Device background task overview

trans-unit.source: When your app is no longer visible to the user, Windows will suspend or terminate your app to reclaim memory and CPU resources.
trans-unit.target: When your app is no longer visible to the user, Windows will suspend or terminate your app to reclaim memory and CPU resources.

trans-unit.source: This allows other apps to run in the foreground and reduces battery consumption.
trans-unit.target: This allows other apps to run in the foreground and reduces battery consumption.

trans-unit.source: When this happens, without the help of a background task, any ongoing data events will be lost.
trans-unit.target: When this happens, without the help of a background task, any ongoing data events will be lost.

trans-unit.source: Windows provides the background task trigger, [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337), to let your app perform long running sync and monitoring operations on devices and sensors safely in the background, even if your app is suspended.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides the background task trigger, [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337), to let your app perform long running sync and monitoring operations on devices and sensors safely in the background, even if your app is suspended.

trans-unit.source: For more info about app lifecycle, see [Launching, resuming, and background tasks](index.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info about app lifecycle, see [Launching, resuming, and background tasks](index.md).

trans-unit.source: For more about background tasks, see [Support your app with background tasks](support-your-app-with-background-tasks.md).
trans-unit.target: For more about background tasks, see [Support your app with background tasks](support-your-app-with-background-tasks.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note** In a Universal Windows app, syncing a device in the background requires that your user has approved background syncing by your app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** In a Universal Windows app, syncing a device in the background requires that your user has approved background syncing by your app.

trans-unit.source: The device must also be connected to or paired with the PC, with active I/O, and is allowed a maximum of 10 minutes of background activity.
trans-unit.target: The device must also be connected to or paired with the PC, with active I/O, and is allowed a maximum of 10 minutes of background activity.

trans-unit.source: More detail on policy enforcement is described later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: More detail on policy enforcement is described later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Limitation: critical device operations
trans-unit.target: Limitation: critical device operations

trans-unit.source: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337).
trans-unit.target: Some critical device operations, such as long running firmware updates, cannot be performed with the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337).

trans-unit.source: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the [**DeviceServicingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297315).
trans-unit.target: Such operations can be performed only on the PC, and only by a privileged app that uses the [**DeviceServicingTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297315).

trans-unit.source: A *privileged app* is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.
trans-unit.target: A *privileged app* is an app that the device's manufacturer has authorized to perform those operations.

trans-unit.source: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.
trans-unit.target: Device metadata is used to specify which app, if any, has been designated as the privileged app for a device.

trans-unit.source: To use the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337), follow these basic steps.

trans-unit.source: Your app registers its background task in the app manifest and embeds the background task code in a Windows Runtime class that implements IBackgroundTask or in a dedicated JavaScript page for JavaScript apps.
trans-unit.target: Your app registers its background task in the app manifest and embeds the background task code in a Windows Runtime class that implements IBackgroundTask or in a dedicated JavaScript page for JavaScript apps.

trans-unit.source: When your app starts, it will create and configure a trigger object of type [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337), and store the trigger instance for future use.
trans-unit.target: When your app starts, it will create and configure a trigger object of type [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337), and store the trigger instance for future use.

trans-unit.source: Your app checks whether the background task has been previously registered and, if not, registers it against the trigger.
trans-unit.target: Your app checks whether the background task has been previously registered and, if not, registers it against the trigger.

trans-unit.source: Note that your app isn't allowed to set conditions on the task associated with this trigger.
trans-unit.target: Note that your app isn't allowed to set conditions on the task associated with this trigger.

trans-unit.source: When your app needs to trigger the background task, it must first call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) to check if the app is able to request a background task.
trans-unit.target: When your app needs to trigger the background task, it must first call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) to check if the app is able to request a background task.

trans-unit.source: If the app can request the background task, it calls the [**RequestAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297341) activation method on the device trigger object.
trans-unit.target: If the app can request the background task, it calls the [**RequestAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297341) activation method on the device trigger object.

trans-unit.source: Your background task isn’t throttled like other system background tasks (there's no CPU time quota) but will run with reduced priority to keep foreground apps responsive.
trans-unit.target: Your background task isn’t throttled like other system background tasks (there's no CPU time quota) but will run with reduced priority to keep foreground apps responsive.

trans-unit.source: Windows will then validate, based on the trigger type, that the necessary policies have been met, including requesting user consent for the operation before starting the background task.
trans-unit.target: Windows will then validate, based on the trigger type, that the necessary policies have been met, including requesting user consent for the operation before starting the background task.

trans-unit.source: Windows monitors system conditions and task runtime and, if necessary, cancels the task if the required conditions are no longer met.
trans-unit.target: Windows monitors system conditions and task runtime and, if necessary, cancels the task if the required conditions are no longer met.

trans-unit.source: When the background tasks reports progress or completion, your app will receive these events through progress and completed events on the registered task.
trans-unit.target: When the background tasks reports progress or completion, your app will receive these events through progress and completed events on the registered task.

trans-unit.source: Frequency and foreground restrictions
trans-unit.target: Frequency and foreground restrictions

trans-unit.source: There is no restriction on the frequency with which your app can initiate operations, but your app can run only one [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task operation at a time (this does not affect other types of background tasks), and can initiate a background task only while your app is in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: There is no restriction on the frequency with which your app can initiate operations, but your app can run only one [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task operation at a time (this does not affect other types of background tasks), and can initiate a background task only while your app is in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: When your app isn't in the foreground, it is unable to initiate a background task with **DeviceUseTrigger**.
trans-unit.target: When your app isn't in the foreground, it is unable to initiate a background task with **DeviceUseTrigger**.

trans-unit.source: Your app can't initiate a second **DeviceUseTrigger** background task before the first background task has completed.
trans-unit.target: Your app can't initiate a second **DeviceUseTrigger** background task before the first background task has completed.

trans-unit.source: Device restrictions
trans-unit.target: Device restrictions

trans-unit.source: While each app is limited to registering and running only one [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task, the device (on which your app is running) may allow multiple apps to register and run **DeviceUseTrigger** background tasks.
trans-unit.target: While each app is limited to registering and running only one [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task, the device (on which your app is running) may allow multiple apps to register and run **DeviceUseTrigger** background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the device, there may be a limit on the total number of **DeviceUseTrigger** background tasks from all apps.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the device, there may be a limit on the total number of **DeviceUseTrigger** background tasks from all apps.

trans-unit.source: This helps preserve battery on resource-constrained devices.
trans-unit.target: This helps preserve battery on resource-constrained devices.

trans-unit.source: Programming a background task
trans-unit.target: Programming a background task

trans-unit.source: Using the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task from your app ensures that any sync or monitoring operations started from your foreground app continue to run in the background if your users switch apps and your foreground app is suspended by Windows.
trans-unit.target: Using the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task from your app ensures that any sync or monitoring operations started from your foreground app continue to run in the background if your users switch apps and your foreground app is suspended by Windows.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you follow this overall model for registering, triggering, and unregistering your background tasks:
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you follow this overall model for registering, triggering, and unregistering your background tasks:

trans-unit.source: Call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) to check if the app is able to request a background task.
trans-unit.target: Call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) to check if the app is able to request a background task.

trans-unit.source: This must be done before registering a background task.
trans-unit.target: This must be done before registering a background task.

trans-unit.source: Register the background task before requesting the trigger.
trans-unit.target: Register the background task before requesting the trigger.

trans-unit.source: Connect progress and completion event handlers to your trigger.

trans-unit.source: Cancelling a background task
trans-unit.target: Cancelling a background task

trans-unit.source: To cancel a task running in the background from your foreground app, use the Unregister method on the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224786) object you use in your app to register the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task.
trans-unit.target: To cancel a task running in the background from your foreground app, use the Unregister method on the [**BackgroundTaskRegistration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224786) object you use in your app to register the [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) background task.

trans-unit.source: Unregistering your background task by using the [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869) method on **BackgroundTaskRegistration** will cause the background task infrastructure to cancel your background task.
trans-unit.target: Unregistering your background task by using the [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869) method on **BackgroundTaskRegistration** will cause the background task infrastructure to cancel your background task.

trans-unit.source: The [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869) method additionally takes a Boolean true or false value to indicate if currently running instances of your background task should be canceled without allowing them to finish.
trans-unit.target: The [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869) method additionally takes a Boolean true or false value to indicate if currently running instances of your background task should be canceled without allowing them to finish.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the API reference for **Unregister**.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the API reference for **Unregister**.

trans-unit.source: In addition to [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869), your app will also need to call [**BackgroundTaskDeferral.Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700504).
trans-unit.target: In addition to [**Unregister**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229869), your app will also need to call [**BackgroundTaskDeferral.Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700504).

trans-unit.source: This informs the system that the asynchronous operation associated with a background task has finished.
